alert.note: Alert for St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 2:56PM CDT until May 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following county, St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 255 PM CDT Sunday, upstream dam releases are causing high flows on the Cloquet River and minor flooding in the advisory area. - Discharge from the Island and Fish Lake dams are higher than normal. The Island and Fish Lake Dams are not in danger of failing. High flows will continue through the weekend but further increases are not expected at this time. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hunter Lake, Bowman Lake, Island Lake, Fredenberg, and Taft - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
